Package ca.cgjennings.ui.textedit

Class SpellingHighlighter

java.lang.Object
ca.cgjennings.ui.textedit.ErrorHighlighter
ca.cgjennings.ui.textedit.SpellingHighlighter
All Implemented Interfaces:
Highlighter
public class SpellingHighlighter extends ErrorHighlighter
A highlighter for source code editors that highlights spelling errors using a SpellingChecker.
Since:
3.0

  • Constructor Details

    • SpellingHighlighter

      public SpellingHighlighter()
      Creates a spelling highlighter that uses the shared spelling checker.

    • SpellingHighlighter

      public SpellingHighlighter​(EnumSet<TokenType> tokenTypesToCheck)
      Creates a spelling highlighter that uses the shared spelling checker. Only text marked with the token types included in the specified enum set are checked.
      Parameters:
      tokenTypesToCheck - the set of token types to check

    • SpellingHighlighter

      public SpellingHighlighter​(SpellingChecker checker, EnumSet<TokenType> tokenTypesToCheck)
      Creates a spelling highlighter that uses the specified spelling checker. Only text marked with the token types included in the specified enum set are checked.
      Parameters:
      checker - the spelling checker to use
      tokenTypesToCheck - the set of token types to check

  • Method Details

    • paint

      public void paint​(Graphics2D g, HighlightedLine hl)
      Description copied from interface: Highlighter
      Called when the highlighter should paint the highlights for a given line.
      Parameters:
      g - the graphics context to use for painting
      hl - information about the line to be highlighted

    • ignoreWord

      protected boolean ignoreWord​(Segment text, int offset, int length)
      Called before marking a word as incorrectly spelled. This allows the highlighter to be more lax about spelling errors than a typical spelling-checked component would be. The default implementation ignores words that use CamelCase or that are connected to other words by any of .:/\.
      Parameters:
      text - a segment containing the contents of the current token
      offset - the offset to the start of the match
      length - the length of the match

    • getToolTipText

      public String getToolTipText​(MouseEvent evt)
      Description copied from interface: Highlighter
      Called when the mouse hovers over the document area long enough for a tool tip to appear. This provides the highlighter the opportunity to provide a custom tool tip for a highlighted segment. If multiple highlighters return a non-null tip, the first non-null tip will be displayed.
      Parameters:
      evt - a mouse event indicating the location of the pointer over the document view
      Returns:
      the tool tip to display, or null

    • getPopupMenu

      public JPopupMenu getPopupMenu​(MouseEvent e, HighlightedLine hl)
      Description copied from interface: Highlighter
      Called before displaying a popup menu over the document area. If it returns a menu, that menu will be displayed instead of the default menu. If multiple highlighters are attached to the editor, the menu from the first highlighter to return one will be used.
      Parameters:
      e - the event that triggered the popup menu
      hl - information about the line where the popup menu was triggered
      Returns:
      a substitute menu, or null to use the default

    • getMarginNotes

      public Set<MarginNote> getMarginNotes​(int lineIndex)
      Description copied from interface: Highlighter
      Returns the marginalia for a line of text. May return null if a line has no margin notes.
      Parameters:
      lineIndex - the line for which notes are requested
      Returns:
      a set of notes for the line, or null
